sentences.english: We saw a film yesterday. Its name was Speed.
sentences.chinese: 我們昨天看了一場電影，片名是《生死時速》。

sentences.english: The downhill course measured 200m and competitors reached speeds of up to 25km per hour, the organizer said.(See photo)
sentences.chinese: 組織者說，參賽選手的最高時速達到了25公里。

sentences.english: The lorry was travelling at 20mph in the slow lane.
sentences.chinese: 卡車在慢車道上以20英里的時速行駛。

sentences.english: They kept the ball very well and broke very quickly on the counter attack.
sentences.chinese: 他們控球很好，在防反時速度很快。

sentences.english: In 1949, the average speed of China's trains was only 43 kmph.
sentences.chinese: 新中國成立初期，鐵路旅行平均時速只有43公里。

sentences.english: Thee typhoon is moving westward at a speed of 20 kilometers per hour.
sentences.chinese: 颱風電母以時速20公里的速度向西而去。

sentences.english: The CRH can zoom at speeds of 394 km per hour.
sentences.chinese: 中國的高鐵時速迅速串升到每小時394公里的水平。

sentences.english: The racing car was clocked at 160 miles p. h.
sentences.chinese: 該賽車的時速爲一百六十英里。

sentences.english: Bob: No, I'm not sure. I think about 65 mph, right?
sentences.chinese: 不，我不知道。我想時速大約是65英里，對嗎？

sentences.english: The storm was moving northwest at 17 miles (28 km) per hour.
sentences.chinese: 而暴風正以28公里每小時的時速向西北方向移動。

sentences.english: The hurricanes have sustained winds of 74mph and up.
sentences.chinese: 颶風維持時速74英里以上的風速。

sentences.english: The jets are thought to be moving at speeds of up to 850,000 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 這些戰機被認爲是在高達85萬英里的時速前進。

sentences.english: Usually, its highest speed is 180 kilometers per hour.
sentences.chinese: 通常，它的最高時速達到每小時180公里。

sentences.english: He was flying now straight down, at two hundred fourteen miles per hour.
sentences.chinese: 他現在是筆直地往下飛，時速二百一十四英里。

sentences.english: That helped their ponies run longer and faster.
sentences.chinese: 這樣有助於他們的馬匹跑得距離更長，時速更快。

sentences.english: The egg-shaped aircraft can reach a top speed of 160 kilometers per hour.
sentences.chinese: 這種蛋形無人機的最高時速可達160公里。

definition: to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
track (for trains etc)/orbit (of a satellite)/(fig.) a person's established path in life/desired trajectory (of a business or other endeavor)/(audio engineering) track/(quantum mechanics) orbital
